message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of "cs.CL" (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing and topic modeling. Additionally, it may also belong to "cs.SI" (Social and Information Networks) as it focuses on microblog conversations and their structure. "cs.IR" (Information Retrieval) is another possible sub-category as the paper discusses methods for summarizing microblog content. "cs.LG" (Machine Learning) and "cs.CY" (Computers and Society) are also possible sub-categories as the paper proposes a joint model that learns both discourse and topic representations, which involves machine learning techniques, and discusses the implications of the model for social media analysis.
